The '''Causeway''' in [[Gondor]] was the walled<ref>{{RK|V1}}</ref> road that ran west from [[Osgiliath]] to the [[Causeway Forts]] in the [[Rammas Echor]] that surrounded the [[Pelennor Fields]].<ref>{{RK|V4}}, p. 807</ref><ref name=gate>{{RK|V10}}</ref>

==History==
It is possible that the Causeway was built before the Causeway Forts.<ref>{{webcite|author=Mark Fisher|articleurl=https://www.glyphweb.com/arda/c/causeway.html|articlename=The Causeway|dated=4 July 2025|website=EoA|accessed=6 August 2025}}</ref>

On [[12 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 12, p. 1093</ref> the attacking [[Morgul-host]]<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 10</ref> that was led by the [[Witch-king]] and outnumbered the defenders ten times managed to cross the Anduin on a large number of floats and barges that they had secretly built on the eastern side of Osgiliath so that Faramir retreated up the Causeway and rallied his men to the Causeway Forts.<ref>{{RK|V10}}, p. 817</ref>

In the early hours of [[13 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 13, p. 1093</ref> the attackers wrecked the Causeway Forts and blasted breaches in the Rammas Echor.<ref>{{RK|V10}}, pp. 818-20</ref>

On [[18 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 18</ref> the [[Host of the West]]<ref>{{RK|VI5}}</ref> left [[Minas Tirith]] and passed "down the great road to the Causeway" to Osgiliath.<ref name=gate/>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
The causeway was originally unnamed when it first appears in an earlier manuscript of what would later become the chapter "[[Minas Tirith (chapter)|Minas Tirith]]".<ref>{{WR|3|III}}, p. 278</ref> In an earlier manuscript of what would later become the chapter "[[The Siege of Gondor]]", the Causeway Forts are described as guarding "the entrance of the causeway into the townlands" and Faramir is said to "have paid dearly for the causeway" instead of "for the crossing".<ref>{{WR|3|VI}}, p. 330-1</ref> The name of the road was first capitalized as Causeway in an earlier version of the chapter "[[The Last Debate]]".<ref>{{WR|3|XII}}, p. 416</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Causeway is a short road leading from [[Osgiliath]]'s "Gates of the Sun" to the [[Causeway Forts]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Gates_of_the_Sun|articlename=Gates of the Sun|dated=13 January 2017|website=[https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Main_Page Lotro-Wiki.com]|accessed=6 August 2025}}</ref> It is part of the [[Great West Road]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/North-South_Road#Great_West_Road|articlename=North-South Road#Great West Road|dated=8 July 2011|website=[https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Main_Page Lotro-Wiki.com]|accessed=6 August 2025}}</ref>
